meanings.definition: To give notice of danger or harm
meanings.sent1: The sign warns drivers of a sharp curve ahead.
meanings.sent2: She always warns her little brother to look both ways before crossing the street.
meanings.sent3: The barking dog warns the mailman to stay away.
meanings.sent4: The dark clouds warn of an approaching storm.
meanings.sent5: The loud thunder warns us to seek shelter indoors.

meanings.definition: To advise or caution about something
meanings.sent1: The doctor warns against eating too much sugar for good health.
meanings.sent2: Parents often warn their children not to talk to strangers.
meanings.sent3: The wise owl warns the young birds to be careful when flying at night.
meanings.sent4: The teacher warns the students to study hard for the upcoming test.
meanings.sent5: The weather forecast warns of heavy rain tomorrow.

meanings.definition: To inform someone in advance of a possible danger or problem
meanings.sent1: The lifeguard warns swimmers about the strong currents in the ocean.
meanings.sent2: The security guard warns visitors not to enter the restricted area.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel warns its friends about the approaching cat.
meanings.sent4: The smoke alarm warns the family of a fire in the house.
meanings.sent5: The guide warns tourists to watch out for slippery rocks on the trail.
